Borek [ˈbɔrɛk] (German Waldwinkel) is a village in the administrative district of Gmina Krapkowice, within Krapkowice County, Opole Voivodeship, in southwestern Poland.[1] It lies approximately 15 kilometres (9 mi) north of Krapkowice and 8 km (5 mi) south of the regional capital Opole.

Borek [ˈbɔrɛk] is a village in the administrative district of Gmina Rzezawa, within Bochnia County, Lesser Poland Voivodeship, in southern Poland. It lies approximately 4 kilometres (2 mi) north of Rzezawa, 8 km (5 mi) north-east of Bochnia, and 42 km (26 mi) east of the regional capital Kraków.[1]

Borek [ˈbɔrɛk] is a settlement in the administrative district of Gmina Namysłów, within Namysłów County, Opole Voivodeship, in south-western Poland.[1] It lies approximately 8 kilometres (5 mi) south-west of Namysłów and 47 km (29 mi) north-west of the regional capital Opole.

Borek [ˈbɔrɛk] (German: Leopoldsdorf) is a village in the administrative district of Gmina Korfantów, within Nysa County, Opole Voivodeship, in south-western Poland.[1] It lies approximately 6 kilometres (4 mi) north-east of Korfantów, 25 km (16 mi) east of Nysa, and 25 km (16 mi) south-west of the regional capital Opole.

Borek [ˈbɔrɛk] is a village in the administrative district of Gmina Turawa, within Opole County, Opole Voivodeship, in south-western Poland.[1] It lies approximately 6 kilometres (4 mi) south-west of Turawa and 8 km (5 mi) north-east of the regional capital Opole.

Borek [ˈbɔrɛk] is a village in the administrative district of Gmina Czerwin, within Ostrołęka County, Masovian Voivodeship, in east-central Poland.[1] It lies approximately 3 kilometres (2 mi) west of Czerwin, 18 km (11 mi) south-east of Ostrołęka, and 94 km (58 mi) north-east of Warsaw.

Borek [ˈbɔrɛk] is a settlement in the administrative district of Gmina Ruciane-Nida, within Pisz County, Warmian-Masurian Voivodeship, in northern Poland.[1] It lies approximately 12 kilometres (7 mi) south-west of Ruciane-Nida, 24 km (15 mi) west of Pisz, and 70 km (43 mi) east of the regional capital Olsztyn.

Borek [ˈbɔrɛk] (German: Borrek) is a village in the administrative district of Gmina Sulęczyno, within Kartuzy County, Pomeranian Voivodeship, in northern Poland.[1] It lies approximately 6 kilometres (4 mi) north of Sulęczyno, 27 km (17 mi) west of Kartuzy, and 55 km (34 mi) west of the regional capital Gdańsk.
Borek [ˈbɔrɛk] is a settlement in the administrative district of Gmina Jutrosin, within Rawicz County, Greater Poland Voivodeship, in west-central Poland.[1]
Borek [ˈbɔrɛk] is a settlement in the administrative district of Gmina Korycin, within Sokółka County, Podlaskie Voivodeship, in north-eastern Poland.[1]

Borek [ˈbɔrɛk] is a settlement in the administrative district of Gmina Wronki, within Szamotuły County, Greater Poland Voivodeship, in west-central Poland.[1] It lies approximately 3 kilometres (2 mi) north-east of Wronki, 18 km (11 mi) north-west of Szamotuły, and 50 km (31 mi) north-west of the regional capital Poznań.
Borek [ˈbɔrɛk] is a village in the administrative district of Gmina Żmigród, within Trzebnica County, Lower Silesian Voivodeship, in south-western Poland.[1]
Borek [ˈbɔrɛk] is a village in the administrative district of Gmina Przemęt, within Wolsztyn County, Greater Poland Voivodeship, in west-central Poland.[1]
Borek [ˈbɔrɛk] is a village in the administrative district of Gmina Lubraniec, within Włocławek County, Kuyavian-Pomeranian Voivodeship, in north-central Poland.[1]

Borek [ˈbɔrɛk] is a village in the administrative district of Gmina Stopnica, within Busko County, Świętokrzyskie Voivodeship, in south-central Poland.[1] It lies approximately 5 kilometres (3 mi) south of Stopnica, 19 km (12 mi) south-east of Busko-Zdrój, and 59 km (37 mi) south-east of the regional capital Kielce.
Borek is a small village in Central Bohemian Region of the Czech Republic, near town Brandýs nad Labem-Stará Boleslav. It has cca 175 inhabitants.

Borek Kamienny [ˈbɔrɛk kaˈmjɛnnɨ] (German: Börken) is a village in the administrative district of Gmina Sulęczyno, within Kartuzy County, Pomeranian Voivodeship, in northern Poland.[1] It lies approximately 5 kilometres (3 mi) north of Sulęczyno, 30 km (19 mi) west of Kartuzy, and 58 km (36 mi) west of the regional capital Gdańsk.
